results.title: Child's play
results.creator_credit: Tom Holland, David Kirschner and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: All Andy Barclay wants for his birthday is a Good Guy doll, regrettably his mother can’t afford one. Upset at being unable to deliver her son’s greatest wish, Karen goes to work only to discover a man selling Good Guy dolls in the alley behind the department store. She approaches the man, and for $30 the Good Guy doll is hers and she takes it home to Andy. However this is no ordinary doll. Following a police chase, serial killer Charles Lee Ray aka the Langshore Strangler, is shot and takes refuge in a doll factory. Before dying he uses voodoo to transfer his soul into a doll, the exact doll Karen buys for Andy. When Andy unwraps his new toy, ‘Chuckie’ continues to kill, his first victim, Andy’s Aunt Maggie. Andy tells the police ‘Chuckie did it’, but no one believes him and he is taken away to a psychiatric institution for children. When the murders continue, Karen discovers that Chuckie is battery-operated, and she forgot to insert his batteries. Detective Norris meets Chuckie and together they try to stop the doll’s killing spree. From an explosive start to an even more explosive ending, Child’s Play has become a cult film, spawning many sequels. Cast includes Catherine Hicks, Chris Sarandon, Alex Vincent and Brad Dourif as Chuckie.

results.title: Day of the dead (D)
results.creator_credit: George A. Romero, Richard Rubinstein, Laurel Productions and United Film Distribution Company
results.brief_description: The third and bleakest of George A. Romero’s ‘Living dead’ series (which consist of ‘Night of the living dead’ and ‘Dawn of the dead’), is also the most goriest. Essentially, society has collapsed and the living dead have taken over the world. The film picks up on a small group of survivors, made up of scientists and a small band of soldiers who have barricaded themselves in an abandoned missile silo. The scientists desperately search for a solution to the zombie plague, while the military become increasingly agitated at their lack of results. Like Romero’s previous outings into the world of the undead, the varied groups are microcosms of human nature and not surprisingly, the most unpleasant characters in this film are not the zombies but the humans themselves. Cast includes Lori Cardille, Terry Alexander, Joe Pilato, Richard Liberty and Howard Sherman.

results.title: Man of marble = Czlowiek z marmuru
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda, Zespol Filmowy 'X' and Film Polski
results.brief_description: Lauded a national hero in the 1950s due to his skills at his trade, Mateusz Birkut has fallen into the shadows. In making a film of the bricklayer’s life, documentary director Krystyna Janda discovers that he used his fame to become involved in politics - resulting in the government wiping out all traces of his accomplishments. Excised by the Polish censors when first released, ‘Man of marble’ uses reconstructions of old black and white newsreels and matches the stylistic tenets of the documentary genre. (Awards: Winner of the FIPRESCI award, Cannes Film Festival, 1978). In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Last seduction
results.creator_credit: John Dahl, Jonathan Shestack and ITC Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: An updated film noir centering around Bridget Gregory, a beautiful, intelligent and ambitious femme fatal. After convincing her doctor husband to pull off a $700,000 cocaine deal, Bridget takes of with the money and hides out in a small town, where she meets Mike. She is tracked down by a private investigator hired by her husband. As the two start to close in on Bridget, she involves Mike in an elaborate scheme to keep the money and get rid of her husband. Cast includes: Linda Fiorentino, Peter Berg, Bill Pullman, J.T. Walsh and Bill Nunn. (Awards: New York)

results.title: Comedian harmonists
results.creator_credit: Joseph Vilsmaier, Senator, Bavaria Film, Iduna and Perathon
results.brief_description: A dramatised account of the legendary German singing group ‘Comedian Harmonists’. Consisting of five singers and a pianist this close harmony group combined smooth melodies and comedy routines, performing jazz songs and German favorites in their own idiosyncratic style. They sang in several languages and starred in more than a dozen films. Vilsmaier tells the story of the groups rise to fame, their international success in the late twenties and early thirties, and their demise in 1934 when the Nazis branded their music as ‘degraded’ and prohibited it- three of the six musicians were Jewish. Essentially an affectionate tribute to the group, the film adopts the style of the traditional musical biopic. As with his earlier films ‘Herbstmilch’, ‘Rama Dama’ and ‘Stalingrad’, in this film Vilsmaier once again focuses on Germany in the 1930’s effectively portraying the treatment of Jewish artists during the National Socialism-Era. Cast includes Ben Becker, Heino Ferch, Ulrich Noethen, Heinrich Schafmeister, Kai Wiesinger, Katja Riemann, Meret Becker and Otto Sander. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: As tears go by
results.creator_credit: Wong, Rover Tang and In-gear Film
results.brief_description: Wong Kar-wai describes his first feature as ‘a tragedy set in the big city, focussing on several ordinary characters in a hopeless situation’. It has also been described as ‘an idiosyncratic riff on the plot and themes of Scorsese’s Mean Streets’. Ah Wah (Andy Lau) is an enigmatic hit man who, with his offsider Fly (Jacky Cheung), is, despite himself, dragged into trouble time and time again. The arrival of his cousin (Maggie Cheung) briefly offers hope of escape from the downward spiral. The emphasis is more on atmosphere and interplay between the three characters than upon plot. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Pretty village pretty flame = Lepa sela lepo gore
results.creator_credit: Srdjan Dragojevic, Goran Bjelogrlic and Cobra Film Development
results.brief_description: Set in the early days of the Bosnian War, this film is based around the relationship of two young men who find themselves on opposing sides in the conflict. Holed up in a tunnel, the Serbian soldiers strive to maintain their bawdy sense of humour while under siege from Muslim soldiers who are torturing and killing those around them. The continuing problem of accountability is highlighted, as soldiers on each side deny responsibility for the atrocities which have affected the other. Meanwhile, their country is torn apart. A powerful anti-war film that conveys the futility of war through the often ironic use of popular music, including a rendition of John Lennon’s “Give peace a chance”. In Serbian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Daytrippers
results.creator_credit: Greg Mottola, Steven Soderbergh, Nancy Tenenbaum, Trick Film Studios and Fiasco Photoplays
results.brief_description: This low budget gem is a charming take on the road movie genre which balances equal amounts of humour and melancholy as it traces a day in the life of a middle class American family. The films events are set off by a love letter that is discovered one morning by Eliza D’Amico (Hope Davis), which is addressed to her husband Louis (Stanley Tucci) and is signed, ‘Forever Sandy’. The distraught Eliza enlists the advice of her close knit family who decide the best course of action is to head into the city and confront Louis at work. So Eliza, her parents, her younger sister Jo (Parker Posey), and her sister’s bookish boyfriend, Carl (Liev Schreiber), all jump in the family car and head to Manhattan. The film then takes on a classic road movie structure as they meet various people on their trip, suffer a few mishaps, and have their own personal revelations along the way. The script by first time director Greg Mottola is full of tender observations and sharp one liners, while the film boasts a wonderful ensemble cast which also includes Pat McNamara, Annie Meara and Campbell Scott.

results.title: The Acid house (D)
results.creator_credit: Paul McGuigan, Alex Usborne, David Muir and Channel 4 Television
results.brief_description: Three stories from Irvine Welsh’s first collection have been adapted in this tongue-in-cheek response to “Trainspotting” and the emergence of The Chemical Generation, a movement Welsh helped to spawn. “The Granton Star Cause”, “A Soft Touch” and “The Acid House” are lethal Scottish fables of drugs, booze and all that which is valued above humanity in the depths of post-Thatcher Britain. But they are also comedies, loud with pitch-black laughter that echoes across a bleak urban landscape where God spends his days in the pub and even the most successful search for identity only leads to hooliganism and excrement. Featuring an unusually intelligent pop-soundtrack, “The Acid House” is not a life-affirming comedy, but it is social commentary at its most painfully entertaining.

results.title: Final Cut
results.creator_credit: Ray Burdis, Dominic Anciano and Segma Limited
results.brief_description: Film makers Dominic Anciano and Ray Burdis have created an original rumination on friendship which blurs the line between documentary and fiction. Jude Law is a recently deceased film maker whose latest film is screened to his grieving family and friends on the day of his funeral. The group is shocked to find that over the last year Jude has in fact been filming them, using hidden cameras to record their most private moments and guilty secrets. Embarrassment gradually turns to fear as the film peels back the layers of their lives, each more treacherous than the last. With liberal use of improvisation and a tour-de-force performance from Ray Winstone, ‘Final Cut’ is a contemporary exploration of morality, mortality and the power of the recorded image. Cast also includes Sadie Frost, Dominic Anciano and Ray Burdis.
